actions.name: Rage
actions.description: Enter a furious state for 1 minute. Gain resistance to bludgeoning/piercing/slashing, advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and bonus to melee damage. Ends early if you fall unconscious or choose to end it.

actions.name: Reckless Attack
actions.description: Gain advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, while granting attackers advantage against you until your next turn.

actions.name: Fast Movement
actions.description: Gain a bonus to your speed while not wearing heavy armor.

actions.name: Danger Sense
actions.description: Gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects you can see.

actions.name: Feral Instinct
actions.description: Advantage on initiative rolls. If surprised, you can act normally on first turn if you enter rage.

actions.name: Brutal Critical (Improved Critical Damage)
actions.description: Roll additional weapon damage dice when you score a critical hit with a melee weapon.

actions.name: Persistent Rage (Subclass/Path dependent)
actions.description: Subclass-specific endurance effects that prolong rage or grant resistances while raging.

actions.name: Frenzy (Berserker)
actions.description: When you rage you can go into a frenzy to make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of your turns, but you gain exhaustion when the frenzy ends.

actions.name: Totem/Primal Path Feature
actions.description: Use subclass/granted features (Bear: resistances, Eagle: mobility, Wolf: ally advantage, etc.). Effects and costs depend on chosen path.

actions.name: Bardic Inspiration
actions.description: Give a creature an inspiration die (d6â†’d12 as you level) to add to ability checks, attack rolls, or saves. Usable a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (or level-scaled).

actions.name: Countercharm
actions.description: Perform to grant allies advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed for the duration.

actions.name: Cutting Words
actions.description: Use your reaction to subtract your Bardic Inspiration die from an enemy's attack roll, ability check, or damage roll.

actions.name: Magical Secrets (Learn Spells)
actions.description: Learn spells from any class list and cast them as a Bard (uses class features to define known spells).

actions.name: Vicious Mockery
actions.description: Cantrip that deals psychic damage and imposes disadvantage on the target's next attack roll if it fails a Wisdom save.

actions.name: Inspire Competence (Expertise/Jack of All Trades)
actions.description: Gain expertise in two skills and a bonus to ability checks from Jack of All Trades equal to half proficiency bonus.

actions.name: Song of Rest
actions.description: While taking a short rest, allies who hear your performance regain extra hit points when spending Hit Dice.

actions.name: Spellcasting (Bard)
actions.description: Cast bard spells using prepared/known spells. Casting time varies; some require concentration.

actions.name: Channel Divinity
actions.description: Consume Channel Divinity to fuel domain abilities (e.g., Turn Undead, Guided Strike, Preserve Life) with effects based on Divine Domain.

actions.name: Turn Undead
actions.description: Force undead within range to make a Wisdom save or be turned (flee) for 1 minute.

actions.name: Divine Strike / Potent Spellcasting
actions.description: Add extra radiant or spell-based damage to weapon attacks or spells once per turn (domain-specific).

actions.name: Spellcasting (Cleric)
actions.description: Cast prepared cleric spells. Many cleric spells require concentration (e.g., Bless, Spiritual Weapon [bonus action cast]).

actions.name: Divine Intervention
actions.description: Call your deity for aid. At higher levels, chance of success increases; on a successful roll the DM chooses effect.

actions.name: Channel Divinity: Turn or Command (Domain Examples)
actions.description: Domain-specific uses of Channel Divinity (e.g., Command Undead, Invoke Duplicity, Radiance of Dawn).

actions.name: Cure Wounds / Healing Word (Spells)
actions.description: Use cleric healing spells to restore hit points. Some are bonus-action (Healing Word).

actions.name: Preserve Life (Life Domain)
actions.description: As an action, restore hit points to multiple creatures up to a limit equal to five times your cleric level.

actions.name: Sanctuary / Bless (Spells)
actions.description: Protect or buff allies using spells that may require concentration.

actions.name: Wild Shape
actions.description: Transform into a beast form that you have seen, assuming the beast's physical stats while retaining mental stats and certain class features. Number and duration depend on level.

actions.name: Combat Wild Shape (Moon Circle)
actions.description: Certain Circle features allow bonus actions in beast form (e.g., bonus attacks or temporary healing through hit dice).

actions.name: Spellcasting (Druid)
actions.description: Cast druid spells focusing on nature manipulation, healing, summoning, and control. Many druid spells require concentration.

actions.name: Wild Shape: Cast Spells While Shifted (Circle-specific)
actions.description: Certain subclass features allow you to cast some spells while in beast form or retain spellcasting uses.

actions.name: Speak with Animals / Beast Speech
actions.description: Use spells or skills to communicate and influence animals; some druid features augment this ability.

actions.name: Wild Companion / Summon Beast (Circle of the Shepherd)
actions.description: Summon or empower beasts and fey; subclass gives bonuses to summoned creatures.

actions.name: Ritual Casting (Druid)
actions.description: Cast spells with the ritual tag as rituals without expending a spell slot, taking additional time.

actions.name: Land's Stride (Ranger-like; some Druid Circles)
actions.description: Move through nonmagical difficult terrain without penalty and resist certain nature effects.

actions.name: Attack (Extra Attacks)
actions.description: Make multiple weapon attacks on your Attack action as granted by Extra Attack (number scales with level).

actions.name: Second Wind
actions.description: Regain a small amount of hit points equal to 1d10 + fighter level (usable once per short rest).

actions.name: Action Surge
actions.description: Gain one additional Action on your turn. Usable once per short rest (scales to more uses at higher levels).

actions.name: Indomitable
actions.description: Reroll a failed saving throw; usable limited times per long rest.

actions.name: Maneuvers (Battle Master)
actions.description: Spend superiority dice to perform maneuvers like Trip Attack, Riposte, Pushing Attack, and Precision Attack, affecting attack rolls and battlefield control.

actions.name: Parry / Riposte (Subclass or Maneuver)
actions.description: Use a reaction to reduce damage or make an attack in response to an enemy's action (feature-dependent).

actions.name: Improved Critical / Superior Critical
actions.description: Increase the range on a natural critical roll (e.g., crit on 19-20).

actions.name: Warding Maneuver / Protection (Eldritch Knight/Champion features)
actions.description: Use subclass features to impose resistance, reduce damage, or protect allies through reactions or passive auras.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike (Martial Arts)
actions.description: Make unarmed strikes that use Dexterity or Strength for attack and damage depending on Monk features; damage die scales with level.

actions.name: Flurry of Blows
actions.description: Spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action after taking the Attack action.

actions.name: Step of the Wind
actions.description: Spend 1 ki point to take the Disengage or Dash action as a bonus action and double jump distance for the turn.

actions.name: Stunning Strike
actions.description: Spend 1 ki point to force a target hit by a melee attack to make a Constitution save or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

actions.name: Ki-Empowered Strikes
actions.description: Unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

actions.name: Deflect Missiles
actions.description: Use your reaction to reduce the damage from a ranged weapon attack; you can catch and throw it back.

actions.name: Evasion (High-level Defensive)
actions.description: When subjected to an effect requiring a Dexterity save for half damage, take no damage on a success and half on a failure.

actions.name: Defensive Ki / Purity of Body (Higher-tier)
actions.description: Access defensive or restorative ki features depending on chosen monastic tradition.

actions.name: Lay on Hands
actions.description: Restore hit points from a pool equal to 5 Ã— paladin level. Uses may cure diseases or neutralize poisons depending on pool and DM ruling.

actions.name: Divine Smite
actions.description: Expel a spell slot to deal extra radiant damage on a successful melee weapon hit. Extra damage scales with slot level; additional effects on undead/fiends.

actions.name: Spellcasting (Paladin)
actions.description: Paladin spells include buffs, heals, and smites. Some spells require concentration (e.g., Bless).

actions.name: Aura of Protection
actions.description: Add your Charisma modifier to saving throws for you and nearby allies while conscious and within aura range.

actions.name: Cleansing Touch
actions.description: End one spell on yourself or another creature. Usable limited times per long rest equal to Charisma modifier.

actions.name: Channel Divinity: Sacred Weapon (Oath-specific)
actions.description: Add Charisma to attack rolls for a weapon for a short duration and make it luminous (Oath-specific examples).

actions.name: Smite: Searing/Thunderous/etc. (Subclass spells/effects)
actions.description: Spend spell slots to apply elemental or extra effects on a hit based on subclass or spell choice.

actions.name: Hunter's Mark
actions.description: Mark a target to deal extra damage when you hit them and to track them more easily. Requires concentration.

actions.name: Favored Enemy
actions.description: Gain bonuses to intelligence checks to track and recall information about chosen creature types.

actions.name: Natural Explorer / Favored Terrain benefits
actions.description: Gain benefits while traveling for chosen terrains (e.g., navigation, foraging, stealth advantages).

actions.name: Primeval Awareness
actions.description: Spend a spell slot to sense certain creature types within a radius for a short time.

actions.name: Colossus Slayer / Horde Breaker / Giant Killer
actions.description: Archetype features that grant extra damage or extra attacks under certain conditions (once per turn rules vary by feature).

actions.name: Spellcasting (Ranger)
actions.description: Cast ranger spells for utility, control, and combat. Many require concentration (e.g., Pass without Trace).

actions.name: Ranger's Companion (Beast Master)
actions.description: Command your animal companion to take actions like Attack, Dash, or Help on its turn; newer UA/errata modify command mechanics.

actions.name: Sneak Attack
actions.description: Deal extra precision damage once per turn when you hit with a finesse or ranged weapon and meet the attack qualification (advantage or ally within 5 feet of target).

actions.name: Cunning Action
actions.description: Use bonus action to Dash, Disengage, or Hide on each of your turns.

actions.name: Uncanny Dodge
actions.description: Use reaction to halve the damage from an attack you can see.

actions.name: Evasion
actions.description: Take no damage on a successful Dexterity save against effects that normally allow half damage on success, and half on failure.

actions.name: Assassinate (Assassin archetype)
actions.description: Gain advantage on attack rolls against surprised creatures and score automatic critical hits on surprised creatures you attack if you hit.

actions.name: Use Thieves' Tools
actions.description: Pick locks and disable traps using thieves' tools and Dexterity checks with proficiency if applicable.

actions.name: Hide / Stealth
actions.description: Attempt to hide or move stealthily using Dexterity (Stealth) checks; rogues excel at hiding and ambushes.

actions.name: Metamagic: Quickened Spell
actions.description: Spend sorcery points to change a spell's casting time (e.g., change a spell from Action to Bonus Action).

actions.name: Metamagic: Twinned Spell
actions.description: Spend sorcery points to target a second creature with a single-target spell (when applicable).

actions.name: Metamagic: Empowered Spell
actions.description: Spend sorcery points to reroll some damage dice of a spell.

actions.name: Font of Magic (Convert Points/Slots)
actions.description: Convert spell slots to sorcery points or sorcery points to spell slots, and spend sorcery points on Metamagic.

actions.name: Spellcasting (Sorcerer)
actions.description: Cast sorcerer spells using known spells and spell slots; many spells require concentration.

actions.name: Wild Magic Surge (Wild Magic Sorcerer)
actions.description: On certain spell casts, roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to produce a random magical effect. Tied to a surge table and may recharge a feature.

actions.name: Bend Luck (Favored Soul/Metamagic-like)
actions.description: Spend sorcery points to add or subtract from another creature's attack roll, save, or check within range (feature-dependent).

actions.name: Eldritch Blast
actions.description: A cantrip that makes a ranged spell attack dealing force damage. It scales to multiple beams as you level and is commonly augmented by invocations.

actions.name: Hex
actions.description: Curse a creature to deal extra necrotic damage on hits and impose disadvantage on ability checks of a chosen ability. Requires concentration.

actions.name: Pact Boon: Pact of the Blade
actions.description: Create a pact weapon you can summon; weapon may be used with Charisma and gain other features via invocations.

actions.name: Pact Boon: Pact of the Chain/Blade/Tome features
actions.description: Use pact boon features like a familiar (Chain), a summoned pact weapon (Blade), or ritual/spell benefits (Tome).

actions.name: Eldritch Invocations
actions.description: Permanent or activatable abilities (e.g., Agonizing Blast adds Cha to Eldritch Blast damage, Devil's Sight grants superior vision).

actions.name: Pact Magic (Spellcasting)
actions.description: Cast warlock spells using a small number of spell slots that recharge on a short rest; some spells require concentration.

actions.name: Mystic Arcanum
actions.description: Gain single-use high-level spells (6th+ level) that can be cast once per long rest without using spell slots.

actions.name: Hexblade Curse
actions.description: Place a curse on a creature to add bonus damage, crit on 19-20 at later levels, and heal when it dies (Hexblade patron feature).

actions.name: Spellcasting (Wizard)
actions.description: Cast prepared spells from your spellbook. Casting time varies; many spells require concentration.

actions.name: Arcane Recovery
actions.description: Once per day after a short rest, regain some expended spell slots with combined levels up to a limit based on wizard level.

actions.name: Ritual Casting
actions.description: Cast spells with the ritual tag as rituals without expending a spell slot, taking additional time.

actions.name: Counterspell
actions.description: Use a reaction to interrupt another creature's spellcasting, potentially negating it based on slot level and counterspell rules.

actions.name: Shield (Reaction Spell)
actions.description: Cast Shield as a reaction to increase your AC until the start of your next turn.

actions.name: Spell Mastery / Signature Spell
actions.description: Gain minor permanent spell benefits (Spell Mastery) or automatically cast known spells once per rest (Signature Spell).

actions.name: Arcane Tradition Features
actions.description: Use subclass features (e.g., School of Evocation's Sculpt Spells, Abjuration's Arcane Ward) that modify spells or provide protective/utility effects.

actions.name: Infuse Item
actions.description: Imbue a nonmagical object with magical properties (infusions). Number and types of infusions are limited by level and known infusions.

actions.name: Spellcasting (Artificer)
actions.description: Cast artificer spells using prepared spells and spell slots. Many spells provide utility and require concentration.

actions.name: Tool Expertise / Tinker
actions.description: Gain doubled proficiency bonus with tools and use tools to craft, repair, or activate magical/mechanical devices.

actions.name: Spell-Storing Item
actions.description: Store a spell in an item for later use, allowing others to cast it from the item or you to expel it under conditions defined by the feature.

actions.name: Flash of Genius
actions.description: Add your Intelligence modifier to a creature's ability check or saving throw, representing a quick insight.

actions.name: Arcane Jolt (Artillerist/Armorer features)
actions.description: Deal extra force damage or heal a creature when hitting with a magical weapon or item (feature-dependent).
